ratings.comment: He gives a surprising amount of attention to individual students. The amount of feedback he gives is incredible. This is a teacher who is motivated to teach students as much as possible. He assigns a lot of work but is forgiving about it to students who are trying to learn. A fun class for people who like the topic and discussion.
Makes his TA do everything. Not helpful, boring. So hard. Dont take his class.

Professor Bengson, although a very personable professor, does a very good job at presenting course content but is a pretty tough grader. He assigns several philosophy papers and grades midterms and finals strictly. Beware of word choice.

I took 304: Appearance v Reality. Bengson was ok, he seems to be pretty smart. There were plenty of times when the class got a little too boring and I was disengaged. The class taught me to think critically though, so I feel like I gained logic skills from it.
Lectures can be a bit boring, but just as long as you understand the material, you will do fine.
Very tough grader. Attendance is mandatory, only 2 allowed absences. Knows his stuff and gets really into it, but not very interesting lectures.

John is a great lecturer, but you must pay attention. There are assigned readings for each lecture and occasional quick pop quizzes to follow, but nothing unmanageable. There are only a handful of papers and two exams. If you skip class, you will definitely miss out on a ton of material that is hard to make up on your own.

He has very interesting lectures and is also very helpful outside of class. Knows his stuff and is quite sweet. You have to pay attention to class, but exams and papers are not so bad. There is a lot of reading, but it's usually easy and he discusses it well in the lecture.

Lectures are very boring and hard to pay attention to. Topics could be interesting, but the material in this course is rarely. AVOID if you can. NOT A FUN elective class. Also we had a one page paper every week compared to other 101 classes that only had the paper every other week
Doesn't write clearly on board. Not really an interesting speaker. I was interested in the topic but not hearing about it from him.

Everyone who rated this guy low doesn't know what they're talking about. Bengson was extremely knowledgeable, very accommodating to help, and a rigorous grader. Getting an A took WORK, but I learned a TON from this class and was deeply impressed. Not for those whose primary interest isn't philosophy or slackers.

He was a disappointing professor. He came to class late every single day, and we were almost never on schedule. Granted, he's a newer professor, but I wasn't impressed with the course overall - we didn't even get to a large portion of the syllabus material.

Found the class to be very interesting. Great professor, knows his stuff.  It's philosophy, so there's not always a right answer or any answer at all, and he tries to get you to think about that. Study the study guides and you'll be fine.

a really nice guy. always willing to help, and he knows his stuff very well. but he's disorganized and lacks clarity. but i think it's because he is not experienced enough. Warning: this class is hard, no matter who teaches it.
First Class of his first semester at madison. Doesn't seem to know what he is doing. Horrible at teaching. Ruined philosophy for me. Class = nap time
